data.title: Alfonso XII
data.text:
Born: 28-Nov-1857

Birthplace: Madrid, Spain

Died: 25-Nov-1885

Location of death: Madrid, Spain

Cause of death: Tuberculosis

Remains: Buried, El Escorial, Madrid, Spain

Gender: Male

Religion: Roman Catholic

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Royalty

Nationality: Spain

Executive summary: King of Spain, 1874-85

Father: Duque de Cádiz (consort)

Mother: Queen Isabella II

Wife: María de las Mercedes (m. 1878, d. 1878)

Wife: María Cristina (m. 29-Nov-1879, two daughters, one son)

Daughter: Maria de las Mercedes (b. 11-Sep-1880, d. 17-Oct-1904)

Daughter: Maria Teresa (b. 12-Nov-1882, d. 23-Sep-1912)

Son: Alfonso XIII (King of Spain, b. 17-May-1886, d. 28-Feb-1941)

High School: Theresianum, Vienna

University: Royal Military Academy Sandhurst

Spanish Monarch 29-Dec-1874 to 25-Nov-1885

Assassination Attempt 1878

Assassination Attempt 1879
